Ubuntu Member since Nov. 2009

=== Who Am I? ===

Hi. I work as an independent IT consultant and my primary focus is on Security. I ocassionally coach organizations and persons to adopt Ubuntu as a viable choice for Desktop OS. I've been a  GNU/Linux user/enthusiast since 1996.

=== Contributions ===

* Member of several <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~luis.lopez/+participation|teams]]</nowiki> inside Ubuntu Community.
** Participating in  <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/~luis.lopez/|Bug reporting]]</nowiki>.
* I worked for Canonical as a Sales Engineer on the definition and improvement of key features that could expedite the adoption of Ubuntu in enterprise environments.
* One of the initial admin members of Ubuntu Colombia Team 
* Ubuntu Member since 2009
* Advocacy about Ubuntu in Cartagena (Colombia) LUG
* Attendance to Ubuntu Release Parties in Montreal,QC
* Participation at UDS Jaunty 2008 (Mountainview, CA) 
* Delivered remote talk about ubuntu and cloud computing for the <nowiki>[[http://softwarefreedomday.org/teams/centralandsouthamerica/Colombia/Barranquilla|Software Freedom Day 2009 at Barranquilla Colombia]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[attachment:Computacion en nube.pdf|Document here]]</nowiki>
* Translated "On becoming Ubuntu Member" by Alan Bell to spanish. Available <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Adquiriendo_la_membresia_ubuntu_Alan_Bell|here]]</nowiki>

=== Projects ===

* Classroom for Colombian NGO (powered by Lubuntu): During this project I donated several computers to a Non-Government Organization in Colombia (<nowiki>[[http://www.ninosdepapel.org/ingles/index.php| Niños de Papel]]</nowiki>). The computers where installed and configured with Lubuntu.

=== Plans for Ubuntu ===

* Improve Ubuntu quality by reporting bugs
* Promote the use of Ubuntu in large organizations
* Provide feedback to the Ubuntu project about enterprise desktop requirements to increase adoption
* Motivate non-technical users to participate on the project
